Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: wordDr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Beethoven for one night in April 2012. I am astonished at the positive reviews for this hotel. Our room was so tiny that the (pushed together twin) beds took up almost all of the floorspace. There was no place to put the suitcase except on the floor in front of the door. The hotel is immediately beside a tram stop, but after taking the tram to downtown, we found ourselves waiting for a ride, in the cold rain, for over 30 minutes twice. Customer service was fine during the day, but the evening clerk was worse than rude. The Internet is a joke. I was never able to log on, and there was no one to help. I have stayed in hotels in Europe, Asia, Australia, North America and South America during the past year (multiple times in most of these locations), and this was the most expensive hotel, with the smallest room, and the most offensive clerk I have ever experienced. As an added disappointment, we saw very few tulips, except for the ones for sale in the stores, and this was in mid April.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: PatT373
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from this hotel after a break with my husband. We felt that it was a nice Bed and Breakfast style hotel but a little overpriced for what was on offer. It's location was alright but not as near to the museum area as described but the tram system is excellent in Amsterdam and with an Iamsterdam card it was easy to get about. There was not too much noise from the cars and trams through the night but either the lift or main doors woke us up by 6.30 am.- the noise seemed to come through the floor. At least we got an early breakfast and was in Amsterdam nice and early! Another slight problem was the limited area for breakfast - just not enough seating for everyone when a few of us arrived at the same time. There was a television in the bedroom but you had to pay at reception for a card to access any programmes at all. We found this strange that no programmes were available for free. Staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Cold noisy room and internet ripoff”
Reviews.Author: Simon G
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel if you can. The room I am in is okay but the windows are crap and I couldn't sleep because of the tram and traffic noise outside. Breakfast is okay although the coffee is awful. What annoyed me the most is that they rip you off big time with using the internet in the room. It costs an outrageous 10 Euros (per day!) to use the internet, a service that costs them nothing to provide but they nevertheless charge you excessively for it. The internet ought to be free these days, it is such a basic service. Even if they charge something, 10 Euros is excessive and nothing but a huge RIPOFF. I hate being ripped off and therefore I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Chris A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel 1st - 5th March. Its location is away from the city centre in a nice area of Amsterdam. The Beethovens location is ideal if you are wanting somewhere to get away from the busy night streets of Amsterdam. The centre of the city is within walking distance approximately 40 minutes. The frequent trams are also very accessible with a stop virtually outside the hotel. Tram numbers from central station were numbers 5 or 24 usually every 10 mins at the outside. The rooms are basic but clean, bathroom was clean and tidy and well maintained. Staff were polite and very helpful. Overall i would certainly reccomend this hotel as a budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “very good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: lucylouEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Good location. Clean, well equipped, with very helpful staff. It is basic, as you would expect from the price, but better than many others in the same bracket. Quiet room, even though it was on the street side of the hotel. Basic self service breakfast but plenty of choice. I would not recommend the pizza restaurant directly opposite. Overpriced, poor quality food, unfriendly to the point of rudeness, and when the starter I ordered had clearly gone off. I saw the chef taste the returned plate and immediately spit it out in front of customers, before throwing the rest of the container in the bin!Pasta was disgusting. Despite our clear dissatisfaction, the bill was still 50 euros. Try Fidelio's- I wish we had!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jake0752
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel while visiting Amsterdam. Staff was very helpful and friendly, rooms were clean, and it is in a great location. However, I had a room which shared a wall with the not-so-quiet elevator. I would recommend requesting a room a little further from it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - close to exhibition”
Reviews.Author: Missulrik
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, although a bit run down. The lift is somewhat frightening, and the coffee for breakfast is one of the worse I've ever had. BUT: the location is excellent. Beethoven street offers good restaurants (try the Fidelio just around the corner) and some nice shops. The tram stops directly in front of the hotel and takes you to the city center in 10 minutes, and, reason for my stay: the RAI exhibition center is 15 minutes walk or 6 minutes by bus away. My room was quite big and had access to kind of a roof terrasse to the back of the house. However, my colleagues had smaller rooms and complained of a tiny bathroom. So, if you are looking for accomodation just close to exhibition or for a city weekend and do not care too much for luxury, this might be a good place for you to stay. And good coffee is available just next door at a coffee chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - not good?”
Reviews.Author: titteringtonrobin
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s all to do with your expectations and why your in Amsterdam in the first place. Seems OK for business but might not be great for couples? Hard to tell? Location was near enough to the centre of town and easy access via the local tram just outside the door. The hotel is quite non descript but Iâ€™ve stayed in worse. Don't go for the breakfast as itâ€™s not good and there is a nice coffee shop next door that seems a better option. Rooms were small and basic but as we were on business did the job. Would I stay again? I'd look for somewhere better but would happily saty again if I couldnâ€™t'.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Hollandsglory
Reviews.Content: We found this charming hotel located in an area which is close to all areas of interest in the Amsterdam area. Small, but very clean rooms, with an outstanding breakfast to complement our visit. The personnel are all very friendly and enjoy giving directions or recommendations to various interesting places, for instance the Rijksmuseum is in walking distance. Restaurants are all available in the neighborhood, with higher class boutiques to please the locals as well as the tourists. If however you want transportation to the center of Amsterdam, the streetcar, which is very clean without graffiti stops about 100 yds from front of the hotel. Pricing is very reasonable, not subject to gauging like other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but by far not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: spadgeHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: Dont know really what was wrong but it just seemed a bit tired! Rooms were basic to fair and a bit grotty. Good point for me it was within walking distance of the Rai centre and close to a tram connection for the centre. Take the number 24 or 5 for central station and Dam square. Breakfast was poor and a bit dry looking, usual ham and cheese (for a change!) Staff were friendly and helpful and the shower was decent. No frills basic+ hotel. Dodgy looking patch of carpet by the bedroom door and nothing to do with me! Stayed in a twin room and the beds were tiny! Had worse though so if you get a decent deal go for it.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: VancouverKoukla
Reviews.Content: Since Amsterdam is very expensive, we found this hotel to be well priced in a very good location and clean. The room was more spacious than we expected. We expected to be a family of 4 crammed into a small room, but they actually gave us adjoining rooms which was nice. The room is very basic and could use some updates. Beds were comfortable. The breakfast is not bad but not great, the eating area crowded and not very comfortable to navigate when there are others there. But it is great to have a breakfast included and we appreciated that. We found this hotel to be the best we could find in our budget and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SadhusWithiPods
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Hampshire Hotel Beethoven in Amsterdam for 5 days in September. Â The hotel is located in the Old South neighborhood and is easy to get to from the airport. Â Take the train to the Old South station (one stop) and then tram number 5 (3 stops). Â It drops you very close to the hotel. Checking in was straightforward. Â However, when we found we were assigned a room that smelled of cigarette smoke the hotel staff very quickly gave us another room. Â Our initial impression of the hotel was not great. Â The hallway carpets are old and the walls badly need painting. Â However, once in the room we were a little happier. Â Bathrooms are small but newly renovated. Â Room was spacious with two large windows. Â Towels and linens are of good quality and the hotel provides a tea kettle. Â  We were advised to buy tickets to the museum online and the hotel staff was extremely helpful in printing the tickets and making sure the bar-codes were legible. There are several places in the neighborhood for breakfast and there is even a super market a block away. Â I should mention that coffee and juice are available in the hotel lobby (all day) free of charge. Â WiFi is available in the room for a charge but is free in the hotel lobby. Â We plan to be back in Amsterdam in the spring and we will most likely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Hostel Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Katmcc82
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was ideal, which is why I booked it but the accommodations were very disappointing. Our room was small and dirty. The walls were stained, the furniture was stained, and the space was minimal. I did notice that other rooms in the hotel were nicer so I guess because we booked on-line in advance, we go the super budget room. For the price, you can probably find a better place in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Tram 5 stop right in front”
Reviews.Author: ptk6660
Reviews.Content: We had a great room, 405, with 4 single beds. The best about this hotel is the location - steps from Tram 5 stop which is 3 stops from Zuid Station. Zuid Station is one train stop from Schipol Airport. The hotel is about a 10 min walk to the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad not good”
Reviews.Author: Soosie999
Reviews.Content: Our stay here wasn't bad but it wasn't anything to write home about either. The service was pleasant but nothing out of the ordinary, the room was smallish - as is most accommodation in Amsterdam (although we could only open the bathroom door about a thrid of the way because the bed was in the way) and the breakfast was so-so. Internet was too expense - the coffee shop next door has free wifi. BUT what a fabulous location right next to a tram stop which allows to you access to pretty well all of Amsterdam. All in all we got what we paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Angie562671
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at this hotel on July 3 2011. First off reception very rude. Breakfast was terrible. Microwaved eggs, microwaved mini hot dogs, cold cuts, not fresh fruit it was canned. Juice out of a machine, coffee out of a machine. not fresh. Yuk Yuk. Beds was better to sleep on plywood. Balcony had broken chairs, and God forbid you wanted a drink and asked for ice. Nope. Apparently ice machine broken for months, I was told to go myself next door to coffee and get some if i wanted ice. Terrible service. No thanks no more. It needs a makeover terribly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good service”
Reviews.Author: LaViajera2009
Reviews.Content: Very good service, helpful and friendly. The room was clean and big. The mattress was too soft for my taste. Breakfast was good. IÂ´d come back again.

Reviews.Title: “good tourist hotel, clean with adequate breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: alanbegood
Reviews.Content: Rather expensive for position and overall quality of public areas but rooms were clean , serviced well and bathroom / shower adequate. It is a 20 minute ride on the No. 5 or 24 tram to the city centre but plenty of trams and the 7 euro 24 hour tram pass is good value if you want to see the city sights. Breakfast is served in a small area near reception but with a good selection of cereals, drinks and continental style food. Staff were very helpful and provided info. and maps of the city. A large supermarket is nearby [A/H] and reasonably priced restaurants are in the area .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in nice location with easy access to all areas of the city”
Reviews.Author: Cammie00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is accessible from Schipol airport by train to Zuid station (6 mins) and from there on the 5 or 24 tram (3rd stop) - brilliant, arrived at hotel within 15 - 20 mins of arriving at airport! The hotel is located in a very nice suburb south of the city. It is a comfotable hotel that provided very good value for money on a bed and breakfast basis. The hotel is relatively clean but could do with a coat of paint in the rooms. That said the rooms were cleaned every day of our 4 day trip with clean towels provided everyday. The room was quiet and afforded a good nights sleep away from all the hustle and bustle of city life. We were allocated room 310 on third floor and to rear of hotel, it was fine. Breakfast was very good and usual european style. Coffee/tea facilities available 24/7. The hotel reception were very helpful and provided excellent advice for touring city. The city centre is accesible by trams outside of the hotel via numbers 5 or 24. The transport system is fantastic and we recommend you obtain the Amsterdam card on either 24, 48 or 72 hours that really do provide value for money and all travel included.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic but clean and very comfortable beds. Bathrooms were sparkling clean with fresh towels every day. Mini fridge, tea and coffee service in the room, coffee place next door and a nice market a block away. Great location and a beautiful neighborhood with some good restaurants (Fidelio, Gauchos, Calzone). Tram stop right out front of hotel and day passes are sold at the front desk. The night desk clerk was especially helpful, arranging our taxi back to the airport and even printing our boarding passes for us. I would definitely go back to Beethoven!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Easy to get to and from Amsterdam by Tram”
Reviews.Author: JK_Robson66 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and would highly recommend. The location is quick to get to from Schipol airport Via Amsterdam South Railway station (only â‚¬2.50 single) and only 3 stops on Tram number 5. Tip: Buy a OV - chipkaart at the book store at Schipol which cost â‚¬17.50 and includes â‚¬10 credit, top this up and activate your E purse on the card at the railway ticket office and you can then use the card for train journeys and the trams etc in amsterdam. You MUST remember to check IN and Check out at the card readers to ensure you are not charged extra for not doing so.To use the Trains you MUST have a minimum of â‚¬20 credit and a minimum of â‚¬4 credit to use the Trams. The system is very similar to the oyster card in London. The hotel is very welcoming and the receptionists are multilingual and very friendly, The hotel room that i stayed in was larger than expected, and the beds were extremely comfortable and well presented with a very warm duvet or comforter as they call it. The rooms are also equiped with a kettle and tea and coffee facilties. The bathrooms are compact but very clean and again well presented. Towels are changed daily and are very clean. The toilet paper is very thin but that was the only negative in the room. A electronic safe is also provided free of charge. Breakfast was served between 7-10 Monday To Friday and 7-11 on a weekend. The breakfast consisted of : Choice of Cereals, Cold Meats and Selection of cheese , Fruit cocktail mix, yoghurt and milk. Boiled eggs, and Omellette and small Hot dog type sausages in a warming grill, however the grill did not have the heating units lit so the HOT foods soon cooled down in the grill. There was also a choice of fruit juice and a welcome Nescaffe automated tea coffee etc machine. The hotel is on the main road and trams can be heard but do NOT cause concern and are not intrusive to your stay. Thank you Hotel Beethoven for a great stay..... We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Good value for off-season”
Reviews.Author: Hemlin
Reviews.Content: We got a good off-season deal on the Hampshire and found it a to be a decent base for our activities. Getting a tram pass to get there and back is essential, but the hotel is close to two major routes. The room was quite large and quite adequate to our basic needs (the bedside tables a a bit small though). If you are in a front facing room the street noise might take a bit of getting used to, but its certainly not as bad as a hotel in the centrum would have been for noise. If you are planning to visit the museum quarter a lot then the loaction is great, as the museumplein is a little under 10 mins walk. We found the desk staff quite helpful on the whole. Room cleanliness was adequate but not outstanding. In summary The Hampshire is a good base for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELLY CLEAN HOTEL ,FRIENDLY STAFF AND COMFORTABLE BED”
Reviews.Author: glyn007
Reviews.Content: i have just come back from amsterdam with my wife and would recommend this hotel to anyone. friendly staff and comfortable bed lovely and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable in a perfect little spot”
Reviews.Author: Smiller24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel from 13th Feb - 16th Feb, we were a bit worried at first because we had to get the train & tram to reach the hotel and neither of us are very good with directions. However, when we reached the train station (which is in the same building as the airport) we found the service very good, most Dutch people speak English so it was easy to understand where to go. You literally get the train and get off at the first stop (Station Zuid) when you get off there you need to walk out of the station up to a platform and get the tram, it takes about 2 mins on the tram and get off at the 3rd stop. When u get off at the 3rd stop the hotel is right there. We found the service at the hotel very good, the room was nice, clean and the beds soooo comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is also very nice and u are allowed tea, coffee or hot chocolate whenever you want. The centre is close enough, and you get to see all the other attractions on the tram on the way to Central Station. We especially enjoyed Leidseplein at night time, its a cool chilled out little square, the Pancake Corner is amazing and The Bulldog is the best place to get some weed if u want it. If you get off at Dam square you are right near Madame Tussauds which is worth a look =) the only thing that put me off Amsterdam is the prices, its expensive to drink/eat, we ordered a bottle of beer and strongbow & it cost 10 euros!!! However, I got the hotet at a really good deal so that made up for it. I would defo recommend this hotel, if you do not want to stay right in the centre this is the best place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: Peteri23 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and tidy. Nicely located within easy reach of centre - walkable. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: weemantam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the old south (OUD ZUID), which (to the first timer) appears a bit out of the way. The thing is, the transport system in Amsterdam is REALLY that good. When you arrive buy the Tram tickets and within ten minutes (from almost immediately outside the hotel - on the 5 or 24) your passing almost everything you need to see. The hotel itself has most of the modern features (TV includes some English channels) as well as in-room wifi (Â£10/24hrs noon-noon) or free-wifi in the lobby. Staff were first class. Rooms did have some draw-backs tough (mostly in the bathroom department). The layouts made adjustment of water temperatures treacherous prior to taking a shower or bath. Toilet paper verges on being single ply. All in all a good night stay, good location (by virtue of a first rate transport system) and if your in-the-know you can get there from the airport for less than 5 euros! Recommended unless yoru hard core and REALLY need to be there in FIVE minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BetaCadmus
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this hotel. It's small, quaint and next to a tram station. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff were very pleasant. The bathroom was a bit on the small side and the breakfast buffet was a rip-off for 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money!!!really cosy and clean rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Tefi85
Reviews.Content: In one phrase - an excellent hotel!! really comfortable rooms and luxurius in my opinion (there was a kettle and we coule make coffee or tea by ourselves!)!! the only negative about the room is that the walls are a bit dirty at some places but other than that, the whole room and toilet was really clean!!(plus there was room service and changing of towels everyday!!). the receptionists were really helpful and willing to answer all our questions and give us instructions! the tram station is right across the hotel and there is a frequent tram service to the centre of Amsterdam!!! Although it's on the street it was extremely quite and we slept really well!! Overall excellent hotel!!! Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “nice quite clean back street supper market facing tram stationand good friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: moudy0
Reviews.Content: nice hotel value for money and staff was helpful a smooth functioning. The tram is just outside, the breakfast is really nice and well served.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, helpful”
Reviews.Author: JulietNovember
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on a business trip and took my 80 year old mother along with me! I needed somewhere near the Hilton, but easy for us to get into the centre. This covered both. It was only 5 minutes for me to walk to conference at the Hilton and the tram stops almost outside the hotel to go into the centre which takes about 10 mins. There is one hour parking in front of the hotel, so you can't leave the car for long. We parked in the Olympic stadium car park (Park and Ride or P+R) which costs 6 euros per day and includes a free tram ticket there and back. I consider the hotel was good and worthy of its rating. The lobby was small with a reception desk and the 8 or so breakfast tables where there were always a few people sitting with laptops during the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean with fresh white linen and extremely comfortable beds and cosy quilts. There was a kettle and tea/coffee. The ensuite just fitted the basics with a shower cubicle. The only disadvantage was the 2 inch gap under the door so it wasn't terribly private, although there was another loo on the landing! I had the window open the first night as I hadn't switched on the air conditioning. Our room was in the front of the hotel and there was some traffic noise, and dustmen arriving at around 5am on one day. So it was a bit noisy however, I always go away with a supply of ear plugs and they worked a treat. Breakfast was excellent. It was a small buffet display but with a very good choice. Fruit juices, cereals, fresh chopped fruit, yoghurt, ham, 3 different cheeses, salami, tomato, cucumber, croissants, breads (and a toaster), warm hard boiled eggs, small sausages, mini omelettes. The hotel even cooked some runny eggs especially for us!

Reviews.Title: “VERY EXPENSIVE FOR NO SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: BernieByrne
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you want sleep - ceilings made of paper! staff and mgnt not interested at all - very expensive for a hotel that claims to be 5 star but have never had such bad night's sleep. All looks ok but worth nothing if you can't sleep. I was offered free breakfast when i went down to the reception at 6.30am but no room change ! too far out too so i think much better value elsewhere - never one sorry from any staff re that my weekend was ruined as i was now knackered having had no sleep - only there for two nights so was a real nightmare - asked for refund told no it was an old hotel and that is why there is no deafening.....but 3 stars - i think no stars is more like it as if you can't sleep it is not much of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent....good location and cheaper than hotels in the centre of city”
Reviews.Author: lisajaynedavies1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Was great value for money. No frills but the room was clean and tidy. Sheets and towels were changed daily. The tram is right outside the hotel and takes you into the centre in 5 mins. We walked one day and it took us just 20 mins. A 4 day tram pass (96 hours) was 19.50 and we bought it from the hotel reception...great value. The hotel staff are helpful and more than ready to give advise on transport and city attractions. The area the hotel is in is very affluent with plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. Would stay here next time without any doubt!! (Only possible problem is parking, it costs about 20 euros a day. We parked in a residential area about 2.5km away (the receptionist recommended this) and it was perfect!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Chutney_Bull_Terrier
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel close to the Vrije Universiteit of Amsterdam. I booked 1 single room in this hotel, which I chose for its location, price and rather good reviews on Tripadvisor. The single room was quite cosy. Free coffee & tea facilities. Ask for a room on the backside, because there are tramways riding all day until 00:30 in the street. Tram 5 (stop in front of the hotel) goes to the business centres or to the city centre and museums.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: smudgeandmisty
Reviews.Content: A small clean well staffed hotel, our room was big, clean bathroom and bonus we had a balcony. The breakfast was the usual European buffet. No bar, but you can get a beer from the vending machine. There is a supermarket 2 minutes from hotel. The 5 and 24 trams are outside the hotel, a very good service takes 15 minute to central bus station. The staff were ready to help, checking route planner for us printing out routes couldn't have wished for better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, pity about the tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: deejay17
Reviews.Content: We were grateful to be able to book in to our Hotel room from the airport even though it was a little early, but after 36 hours of travelling it was much appreciated. The service, staff and position of the hotel were great, however the rooms were extremely small when two people and luggage are added. Breakfast was included in our rate and was plentiful, fresh and well-presented in spite of the limited seating area. With a tram stop outside, nowhere is far away and this was great, enabling us to see more than otherwise we may have.

Reviews.Title: “In need of makeover”
Reviews.Author: DutchBVtraveler
Reviews.Content: Disappointing is the word that comes to mind. It is in a good location and looks okay at the entrance and in the lobby, but it disappoints after this. Impressions from point of entry to getting to the room: - I'm informed at reception that I have a choice of paying for the room completely up front for all nights, or the hotel will keep a lock on my credit card for this amount until the transaction is closed out at the end of my stay. - Elevator has the look and feel of a freight elevator. It thinks twice about whether it wants to go and then bumps once before actually starting the ascent. - Elevator door opens to 1970's curtains flanking a huge Coke machine (EUR 2.50/Coke) - Hall carpet is stained and worn - Hall door has been progressing damaged over time by the housekeeping cart - Fire hose is exposed in the hall rather than recessed in a cabinet - Room door opens okay and starts to close after I enter but then hits the partially ripped out burglar lock and then fails to shut fully without assistance - The walls appear to me to be asbestos painted stark white with no decorations on most walls other than the black of suitcases which have scuffed the one wall where the suitcase stand sits. - Water-based heating radiator is turned off. It works when I turn it on and I adjust it to level 3, but then I see that the window curtains hang completely over the radiator such that I need to bunch them up on top of the radiator if I want heat from the radiator to come into the room instead of staying on the window side of the curtains. - The bathroom is a self-contained drop-in unit that is very small compared to the size that it could be based on the size of the hotel room. It is almost possible to stand up from the toilet without hitting yourself on the industrial toilet paper holder in front of you. Stepping into the shower requires navigating between the toilet and the toiler paper holder after which I found that the shower door does not close without risking cutting your fingers by reaching down underneath and manipulating the slider on the lower track. Luckily once the shower is completely wet, the door slides open easier. - Bed is comfortable. - Room has two chairs for sitting, but they are hardly inviting to sit in. - TV is old type but functional. - Wireless internet is EUR 10 per day (noon to noon). Works fine. - Breakfast is best described as ordinary. Functional breads, basic meats (no Salmon, no Westfalen ham), basic cheese (partially oxidized from sitting out at prior day's breakfast), no yogurt. Instant coffee is okay but not great. Breakfast area has a plasma screen TV. This is nice. Wish they had these in the rooms. - Staff is enjoyable to talk to over breakfast in the morning. One of the guys is especially sociable. - Easy access to Tram 5 for travel to WTC and south-axis businesses. Tram stop is just outside the door. Also it is a pleasant walk from here to WTC when the weather is nice. The staff were a highlight. But the hotel needs a makeover. Don't believe the sign in the elevator which says 'Excuse the renovation'. This sign is left over from summer 2008. There is no renovation going on, although there needs to be. If you're okay with a hotel that has no soul, I would recommend the Qbic Hotel in the WTC instead of the Hampshire. At at least in the Qbic the bathroom is bigger, and there are no asbestos-looking walls. In my opinion the reasonable price doesn't adequately compensate for the sub-par conditions at the Hampshire.

Reviews.Title: “Worked just Great for me”
Reviews.Author: SirDaniel
Reviews.Content: I just needded a place to stay and got so much more. The staff went out of their way to make my stay the best. I was the only man staying in the Hotel for five days and all the others were women from all over the world. I did not pay any attention to the carpet because the price was just the best. I made so many new friends there I will never forget it. I was just looking for a nice place and some fun and I got more then I bargained for. SirDanniel

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding but certainly good”
Reviews.Author: Eryan99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February 2008 for a few days. The first thing they asked us at the moment of check-in was our credit card, and we were immediately charged for the total amount of our stay. I know that sometimes this might be the policy of the hotel, but I didn't like it. Anyway, the room we got was very clean, but was SMALL!!! Even our bed was not a king size(1.60mt) but a french size(1.20mt) because probably a bigger bed couldn't fit in that small room!!! There was no place were to put your luggage, not open nor closed, and the wardrobes were not enough if you had to stay a few days. I'm not even mentioning our bathroom. you had to be a tumbler to take a shower! However, I would like to point out that the room was CLEAN and it was cleaned every day properly. The breakfast was great, and there was always tea and coffee available for free. Internet was not free but it was certainly much better than in many other places. The staff was very kind. The location is simply great, everything is easy to reach by tram from where this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and very clean - on tram line”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Mullican
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with friendly staff located a few meters from the tram stop. The room was very clean, large and included a balcony. Breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of items. We found it centrally located with most major attractions a ten-minute (or less) tram ride away. Staff went out of their way to be helpful and suggested some excellent restaurants. Denver Mullican

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: choc_mouse
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least 3 times this year, which means it's not bad. However, it's nothing outstanding either. The main reason for staying here is that it's very close to the WTC (10 minutes walk) and the prices are reasonable (100 Euro/night on average). A supermarket's just round the corner which is handy for snacks as well as several restaurants on Beethovenstraat. I've stayed in a single room, a small double room and a large double room. The small double was the worst, because it looked like it was meant for a single room but they just put an extra bed there so there was no space to walk around. But on the whole it's a comfortable place to stay. Air con has been fitted since the summer, but they aren't functional yet. I found it a bit cold a couple of times and once I got back from work early, there was no hot water. Breakfast is typical continental. The dining area is small and there was one occasion where I had to wait for a table to be cleared before I could sit down. 24 hour reception and you're supposed to leave your room key if you go out. They lock the front doors after 10pm but you just ring a bell and the receptionist opens it if you're out late. Tram is right outside the door (number 5) which takes you do WTC Zuid or to Central Station. TV is OK in the room. You can buy smoovie TV, which has the additional channels, but I've never tried. There's normally 3-4 channels with something English on (inc. BBC and CNN). They have Wifi throughout the hotel, but it's terribly expensive. It's 10 Euro from noon to noon. It would be better if it was 24 hours from first use, but seems like they want to make money from each night you stay. Bathrooms are tiny!!! Even in the large double room, it seems like they wasted a lot of space with nothing - could have had a large jacazzi in there, but they just had the tiny cubical bathrooms, just enough space to dry yourself after the shower. No minibar, fridge or room service, just a kettle and mugs for making tea/coffee. Rooms are cleaned daily, though they didn't clean a cup I used for tea once. The lift could also do with a replacement as it looks and feels old.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, looked like someone had died in the room”
Reviews.Author: AJ99
Reviews.Content: We were staying in a large group and arrived last at about 10pm. i dont know if this had any bearing on the room we were allocated but the room had what looked like old blood/ rust stains all over the carpet. As we went out for a drink almost immediately on arrival it wasnt until midnight we got back and i noticed stains showing through the bedsheet. I foolishly pulled back the bedsheet and noticed the bed was covered in blood stains. We didnt want to complain because there was so many of us but I did afterwards, i would never stay here again it was disgusting. Best Western have apologised but its put me right off! Amsterdam on the other hand was lovely which was just as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Tiger
Reviews.Content: It's true - the carpets are a little tired, and the rooms are not the most spacious I've ever experienced, but that will not put me off making further bookings here. I've stayed here twice this year, and on both occasions found the staff to be both helpful and friendly (seamingly a Dutch trait) The trams stop after midnight, so I didn't find the street facing room overly noisey. The district is quiet residential. The room I had to the rear overlooked a garden, and was very much quieter. Although there is a general collection of bric a brac visible in the gardens below, you'd probably expect this. I was fortunate to have a balcony, which was a cool place for a drink in between wanderings around Amsterdam. The hotel was generally and the room particularly clean. Breakfast was nothing exceptional - usual continental cold buffet. The griddle plate is now out of order, and it doesn't look like it will be fixed, but who goes to Amsterdam in the search of a breakfast? There is a tram stop almost in front of the hotel Spui being about 15 mins away and Dam 20. If you don't fancy a trip out to eat, there are some cafes and restaurants along Beethovenstraatand. Parking can be a bit of a problem. I have used, and recommend using the P+R Olymich Stadion. 5.50 Euros per day if you get the special ticket that includes a free tram ticket (tram 24) taking you to the door of the hotel. You can get cheaper hotels in Amsterdam, but you take your chances with some of the smaller ones. Overall I thought this hotel represented good value for money and I will have no hesitation in coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleApple
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel - the staff went out of their way to be helpful -we would definately stay here again as it is only a 5 minute tram ride away from the centre and is in a lovely clean part of town. Ignore the previous reviews about 'worn carpets' etc and just go for it. For a city break it's ideal. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “carpets need replacing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam 2 weeks ago. I had requested a triple but only got a double-but the staff was quick in bringing a cot to the room. But it made it rather tight in the room. The carpets in the corrider are horrible and in bad need of replacement..but the room was clean enough and the staff pleasant. And yes the tram is right outside the hotel and very noisy. Breakfast was great.. a grill and the fixin's so you can fry up your own bacon and eggs plus other breads and rolls. It's in a safe neighborhood and as long as you don't expect alot it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for the service offered”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were totally disappointed with this hotel: the room was a good size but the carpet was in desperate need of cleaning if not replacing. The bathroom was one of those that you could use the loo and brush your teeth at the same time...very very small! breakfast was very poor, should have been a buffet ...yeah, if you call that two slice of cheese, ham and overcooked eggs, let alone the coffee or tea... I would not recommend it, you can find much better hotel closer to city centre at a lower price. By the way, we checked out a day earlier and booked in somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamLover
Reviews.Content: I was given a very large room for single occupation. Very comfortable bed. The carpets were a bit grubby. Breakfast was slightly below average. Not much choice - and expensive. The lift button on the ground floor frequently didn't work. We all had to share two big tables. The staff were friendly enough. Beethoven street is excellent for shopping and had some good restaurants especially a top-class Chinese close to the hotel. I would only go again if the rates were cheap. Vic March 2005

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at this hotel, staff were very helpful, breakfast was good. Room had a light that needed attention and this was repaired promtly. The location was near the City about 20 mins by tram and 10 mins by taxi. A nice quite location not too far away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great find outside Amsterdam city center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If I were touring Europe and had to stay outside a city center once, I'd do it in Amsterdam in this hotel. The neighborhood is great and the tram that stops outside the hotel is quick and frequent. If you get a room facing the street (like I did), that same tram may keep you awake, but that was the only complaint: my room were big, comfortable, and clean and the staff was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location-basic but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Felix222
Reviews.Content: Just back yesterday from staying at the AMS Beethovanstraat (though they are now a Ramanda). Its a basic hotel -carpet and decor is very worn but the rooms are clean, the staff is helpful and the breakfast has enough of an assortment to please most tastes. A little advice when checking in indicate you want a room located at the front of the hotel. They first tried to give us a tiny room at the back (saying it was quietier) but has a view of the garbage bins. The large rooms everyone is talking about in their reviews are all at the front of the hotel-Beethovanstraat is busy but quiets down at night. Plus you want a city view,you're in Amsterdam, after all. The location is perfect since trams make everything only minutes away and is a nice relaxing way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you don't expect luxury, this one fits the bill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't let your expectations get to high - this is definitely just a basic 3 star hotel - the carpets and fittings look a bit work but it's clean and has all the essentials. The staff are friendly and the best thing about is the location. It's on a very respectable street and there's a tram stop practically outside the door - and it's sooh easy to get around by tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: LT_Minn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. It is in a great location in a nice neighbourhood. There are shops and restaurants all around. The tram stops right near the hotel and you can easily travel to the centre of the city or to the Amsterdam-Zuid railway station. The staff are very friendly, very helpful. My room was clean and quite large. Breakfast is tasty and several different items are on offer, sure to suit many tastes. Beethovenstraat is fairly busy, but not overwhelmingly so. Staying here puts you in the heart of a typical Amsterdam district, away from the posh Jordaan, out of the loud and clubby parts; it's just a nice, comfortable, pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality and amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent eight nights at this warm hotel. The rooms are much larger than most hotels in the centre of the city. The location is very convinient. However, the best assest the hotel has is the STAFF. Everyone from the reception desk on was warm, friendly, courteous and very helpful. It truly felt like a home away from home and it made all the difference to come back to the hotel after a long day of screenings and meetings at the documentary film festival. One of our colleauges fractured her wrist - they arranged for the hospital. I had a cast on my foot - they called the museums to see if there were wheelchairs availabel. prentations needed to be printed out - they did it without any fuss. They gave great travel tips and suggestions. Kudos to the management - they know what it means to keep their staff happy - it makes all the difference. Do stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampshire Hotel - Beethoven
HotelInfo.Address: Beethovenstraat 43, Amsterdam 1077 HN, The Netherlands
